desc: Automated C# tests for Windows desktop application and increased testing coverage by 10%
Initiated a large scale testing codebase refactoring, reducing more than 4.2k methods and 150k lines of code
Developed GitHub Actions workflows and pipelines for automating the run of e2e web tests on virtual machines
Explored and documented latest monitoring and observability tools such as Datadog and Azure monitoring for Kubernetes cluster
Developed interactive React dashboard for QA (link to sample version included below)
experiences.caption: Desktop application Oasis Montaj

desc: Exploring deep learning, neural networks, and computational techniques to model the next generation of 3D dust maps
Designing and fine-tuning neural networks based on the physics involved in the problem
Extensively utilizing tensorflow, scipy, sklearn, and matplotlib python libraries and Jupyter notebook to implement designs and test accuracy using noisy simulated data
experiences.caption: Gaia's view of dust in the milky way “A 3D Dust Map Based on Gaia, Pan-STARRS 1, and 2MASS,” Gregory M. Green et al 2019 ApJ 887 93. https://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.3847/1538-4357/ab5362

desc: Consulted with clients from local restaurants in Scarborough and researched ways to assist in elevating their web functionality to increase business marketing during the pandemic
Improved frontend navigations and design and created forms to gather user information through backend Firebase database

projs.name: HomeyBot
projs.desc: A discord bot that creates a safe space for the community, as dictated by the community. The goal is to use community-based decision-making to choose what is deemed as inappropriate words, graphic images, or sensitive subjects and how to deal with it.

projs.name: AccessMe
projs.desc: A chrome extension that provides an all-in-one solution to personalize your browsing experience and takes us one step closer to universal accessibility on the web.
